com.simulus.controller

Class SimulationController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.simulus.controller.SimulationController

  • public class SimulationController
extends java.lang.Object
    A controller managing the simulation. Changes in simulation parameters, starting and stopping the simulation are done here. The class implements the singleton-pattern and can hence be used as central entry point to reach out to the current instance of the map or the UI controllers.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static SimulationController getInstance()

      • startSimulation

        public void startSimulation()
        Starts a new simulation

      • resetSimulation

        public void resetSimulation(boolean reloadMap)
        Stops the current simulation, reloads the map depending on reloadMap, and resets the canvas, statistcs and settings to the default.
        Parameters:
        reloadMap - Whether or not the current map should be reloaded from its file.

      • init

        public static void init()
        Offers a clean way to initialise the controller without calling getInstance()

      • removeVehicle

        public void removeVehicle(Vehicle v)
        Notifies the map that the passed vehicle should be removed.
        Parameters:
        v - The vehicle to be removed.

      • spawnAmbulance

        public void spawnAmbulance()
        If there a are no more than 4 ambulances on the map, this method reaches out to the map to spawn an additional ambulance.

      • isDebug

        public boolean isDebug()

      • setDebugFlag

        public void setDebugFlag(boolean debugFlag)
        Enables/disbales debug mode. In debug-mode, paths on intersections are visualised, occupied tiles are coloured in green and the AreaOfEffect of ambulances are shown as a red circle surrounding them.
        Parameters:
        debugFlag - Whether debug mode should be enabled or not
